page.title: 12Religion
page.content: The area cuts across three parish boundaries - Fyfield, Willingale and Beauchamp Roding. Each parish is in a different deanery -Ongar, Chelmsford and Dunmow but only two rectors run these parishes: Rev. Peter Turner (Willingale and Fyfield) lives in Fyfield and the Rev. Excel (Berners Roding). Willingale Parish Church has two buildings because formerly it was two parishes - Willingale Doe and Wilingale Spain. The two buildings share one churchyard and are built at the highest spot in the village. There are 4l on the electral roll, 22 from within the parish and an average attendance of 12. St. Andrews is the older of the two buildings and has some interesting stained glass. St. Botolphs is the church at Beauchamp Roding. It is interesting because it is completely isolated
